p: A. copa has been shown to possess significant biological activities such as antioxidant ( Pérez-García et al., 2001; Catalán et al., 2007), analgesic and topical anti-inflammatory activities via inhibition of nitric oxide production, reduction of prostaglandin E2 levels and inhibition of cyclooxygenase-2 activity ( Miño et al., 2004), inhibition of synovial phospholipase A2 activity ( Moscatelli et al., 2006), spasmolytic activity ( Gorzalczany et al., 2013a) and vasorelaxant and hypotensive effects through the inhibition of Ca 2+ influx via membranous calcium channels and intracellular stores ( Gorzalczany et al., 2013b).
